title: Khloé Kardashian Turns Off Instagram Comments After Trolls Claim Her Face Is "Unrecognizable"
text:
From Cosmopolitan

Khloé Kardashian has tuned off Instagram comments after posting a photo of herself that fans are calling "unrecognizable."

People are accusing Khloé of not looking like herself at all and using too much photoshop.

Have you checked out Khloé Kardashian's Instagram lately? Because the reality star and Good American designer is going through it on social media thanks to a photo she posted that has fans claiming she's fully unrecognizable. And honestly, everyone is being pretty harsh—to the point where Khloé had to turn off comments on her recent posts.

The Instagram pic in question features KoKo smiling at the camera, and for what it's worth she claims it's an "old photo" in the caption.

While comments are currently off (presumably thanks to trolls doing the most), people have, naturally, taken it to Twitter to go deep in their Khloé Kardashian feelings.

you want me to believe THIS is khloe kardashian? foh pic.twitter.com/BMdofSVmIc — get loudinator (@gukkieboi) October 1, 2019

Is it just me or @khloekardashian did something to her face????? This is not a hate tweet, I love Koko she’s the realest but there’s really something diff about this selfie of hers 🤔 pic.twitter.com/F5kHbFAJF2 — Girl Gang (@gorlpower_) September 30, 2019

Of course, we all know that Khloé looks like herself IRL thanks to this thing called Keeping Up with the Kardashians, so photoshop is being blamed for this picture looking a lil' different:

Can we talk about Khloe Kardashian for a sec. like just wow.



Why photoshop yourself that you’re not even recognizable. pic.twitter.com/O1XP4xTphQ



— AmburleenRead (@WasabiTwinkie) October 1, 2019

Khloe Kardashian literally looks CGI in this pic.twitter.com/90s6lvpzdX — Hann🦔 (@yasssshannah) September 30, 2019

Either way, can Khloé live?! If she wants to post a photoshopped pic to Instagram that seems like her business, and who among us hasn't dabbled in the fine art of Facetune? That said, there is a conversation to be had about Instagram vs. Real life (in a nice, non-judgmental way), so with that in mind.... Are you alarmed by the abundance of photoshopped pics you're seeing on the Kardashians' Instagrams lately, or does it just go with the territory at this point? Smash! That! Poll!
